means: 文艺颓废期的，颓废派的

sentence.Network_en: Bennett launched a crusade for "moral values" against decadent "liberal relativism."
sentence.Network_cn: 贝内特发起了一场捍卫“道德价值”、反对腐朽堕落的“自由相对论”的战争。

sentence.Network_en: Don't let decadent ideas eat into yourselves.
sentence.Network_cn: 别让颓废的思想侵蚀你们.

sentence.Network_en: Bullfighting was left with the new decadent method, the almost impossible technique.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们留给斗牛事业的遗产是:堕落的新方法令人生厌的技艺.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 心理学专业词汇翻译辞典 - MBA智库文档 ... decadence 堕落 decadent 颓废的 decalage 滞差.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from French décadent, from medieval Latin decadentia (see decadence)

entry.def: If you say that a person or society is decadent, you think that they have low moral standards and are interested mainly in pleasure.

example.ex: ...restrictions on the number of decadent western films that were allowed to be shown.
example.tran: 对颓靡的西方电影在上映数量上的限制

example.ex: ...the excesses and stresses of their decadent rock 'n' roll lifestyles.
example.tran: 他们颓废的摇滚生活的种种放浪及层层重压

means.word_mean: 1. a person who has fallen into a decadent state (morally or artistically)
1. marked by excessive self-indulgence and moral decay;

sentences.sentence: "a decadent life of excessive money and no sense of responsibility"

auth_sentence.content: This was the decadent late stage of Neolithic life.
auth_sentence.res_content: This was the decadent late stage of Neolithic life.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This was the decadent late stage of Neolithic life.

auth_sentence.content: I thought that was decadent and vaguely immoral.
auth_sentence.res_content: I thought that was decadent and vaguely immoral.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I thought that was decadent and vaguely immoral.

auth_sentence.content: He is sorely missed in our decadent culture.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is sorely missed in our decadent culture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is sorely missed in our decadent culture.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =fall,表示"落下,降临"; 2. 引申为偶然发生

stems_affixes.word_buile: cad落下,降临+ence表名词→落下的声音→声音高低抑扬

sentences.en: Don’t let decadent ideas eat into yourselves.
sentences.cn: 别让腐朽的思想侵蚀你。
